p: Bacteriophages (or phages for short) represent a significant modulator of the gut microbiome [ 15]. By definition, phages infect bacteria, but more and more data highlight the interrelation between eukaryotic cells and bacterial viruses. Phages can interact directly with the human body since they can translocate inside eukaryotic cells [ 16] and activate the immune system, exacerbating ongoing colitis symptoms and boosting the antibacterial response [ 17]. It has recently been proposed to consider phages as human pathogens [ 18].
